Andrew sat in the back of his college English class as he finished up his essay and handed it in to his professor. He barely paid attention in class today because he was mostly interested in going out tomorrow night which was his 21st birthday.

Andrew was attending a junior college right now still figuring his life out. He worked part time as a server at a local restaurant in town. He had a small one bedroom apartment and mostly spent his free times playing video games or hanging out with friends. His mind was mostly set on turning 21 tomorrow.

Nowadays turning 21 didn’t mean you were just old enough to drink it also meant you officially a man forever. 18-21 became known as the 3 years of hell for men Andrew’s age. That’s because they knew at anytime they could be selected for the gender draft.

Having your gender forcibly changed against your Will sounded like a nightmare. The only thing you got for it was a small government stipend of $1000. Basically a cheap apology from the government for changing your life forever.

Andrew knew the reason why the draft existed. He learned about the gender drought and how he was born right at the start of it. It was a necessary evil to protect humanity but it also felt like science trying to play god sometimes.

However none of that mattered to Andrew anymore. Tomorrow was freedom day for him! His buddies Dave and Jake were taking him out for drinks tomorrow night and he couldn’t be happier.

Andrew got back to his apartment as he noticed an odd piece of paper tapped to his front door...

It was a bright yellow letter with red letters on it that said “Urgent” on it.

Andrew felt the lump in his throat as he slowly reached up and grabbed the letter and saw it was addressed to him...from the FGA...The Federal Gender Administration.

It was a notice he was selected for the gender draft...

15.content:
Andrew stared at the envelope as if it were a venomous snake. Curiosity kept drawing him back, to examine it. Desperately he hunted for some sign it was a prank, or a mistake. Actually receiving mail was such a rarity nowadays, it felt kind of surreal.

Tilting his head, to it caught the sunlight from different angles, Andrew watched the hologram logo. It seemed to rise above the surface of the envelope. It's colours shifting from a soft pale blue, to a pastel pink. Even the logo felt like it was mocking him.

He had a party planned in two days time, he intended on facing that as a man. Celebrating with his friends.

- - - - -

The anomaly had seemingly come out of nowhere. Just a slight spike in male births one year. When Andrew was born himself, it was only a tiny difference. On the verge of being dismissed as a statistical blip. With 52% male births, and 48% female. Now he was 21. He stopped himself, the precision felt childish. Like declaring his age as twelve and a half years old. But ... technically, he wasn't 21 yet.

He didn't want to become female. With the rate now far beyond statistical variance. It was 75% male, and 25% female. The world scared his parents, but as Andrew grew up this was normal. His classes were slightly male heavy, and their was a degree of prestige, of competition in having a girlfriend.

At college, one friend: Jack Williams had married his girlfriend. That had felt reckless and wild to Andrew, sure he knew Jack was exempted from the Gender Lottery, but that hadn't felt terribly real. Now he felt an icy sickness in the pit of his stomach.

A chirp came from his phone, and hoping for a distraction he pulled it out. The top of the messages was a confirmation. An e-mail, from the Federal Gender Administration. His hands trembled, he dropped his phone to the carpet. His last hope that his friends were pranking him as a birthday joke evaporated.

"No!" He told himself. "No... maybe... it is because of my birthday!" Hope surged. "Maybe it's a message letting me know I'm out of the draw now. That I'm free from that risk. That my country needs me, as a man, to breed our way back to a healthier ratio."

But, even as he thought that Andrew knew it was a faint hope, a last desperate drowning man snatching at twigs.

Nothing David could say would convince Andrew that one of his other friends wasn't behind the cruel prank. A night of drinking and partying lay ahead of him... Spoiled now, by this.

info.brief_description: To help stabilize the population some men are forced to change their genders
info.description:
In the near future a population abnormality caused a huge spike in male birth rates and a sharp decline in female. Males born were 75% of all new births.

With 3 out of every 4 babies born being male the government had a crises on its hand and used all its resources to find a way for more females to be born. However after years of tireless research the best they could come up with was a serum that changes males into females. The problem is the serum only works on adults.

With no other options the government began what became known as the Gender Draft, or Gender Lottery.

Basically any babies born after a certain date were entered into this lottery which starts at age 18 and goes until age 21. After 21 you are removed from the lottery.

This program was designed to get the population as close to 50/50 males and females and possible. While successful this draft is hated by many who feel like their freedom is taken from them.

You are Andrew Wilson, and tomorrow is your 21st birthday. It is normal to celebrate with friends knowing your manhood is secured so you have big plans to celebrate with your friends. However when you come home you find a letter from the government with your name on it...

You have just been selected for the Gender Draft
